com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth

Class BluetoothAdapterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapterManager

  • public class BluetoothAdapterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton that wraps some helpful functionality for the BluetoothAdapter related to device scanning as well as checking if Bluetooth is enabled on a device or not. Created on 2/12/15.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BluetoothAdapterManager.BluetoothStatus
      Indicates the status of Bluetooth on this Android Device.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean bluetoothIsEnabled()
      Determines if Bluetooth is currently enabled on the Android device.
      boolean deviceSupportsBluetooth()
      Determines whether the current Android device supports Bluetooth or not.
      void disableBluetooth()
      Disables Bluetooth on the Android device by calling BluetoothAdapter.disable()
      BluetoothAdapterManager.BluetoothStatus getBluetoothStatus()
      Determines what the current BluetoothStatus of the Android device is.
      static BluetoothAdapterManager getInstance()
      The shared instance of the singleton.
      static void showRequestBluetoothPermissionDialog(android.app.Activity activity, int requestCode)
      Helper method for displaying the built in Android dialog, requesting permission to turn on Bluetooth.
      void startLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback callback, android.bluetooth.le.ScanCallback scanCallback, java.util.List<android.bluetooth.le.ScanFilter> scanFilters, android.bluetooth.le.ScanSettings scanSettings)
      Starts a BLE scan.
      void stopLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback callback, android.bluetooth.le.ScanCallback scanCallback)
      Stops a BLE scan.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BluetoothAdapterManager getInstance()
        The shared instance of the singleton.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance.

      • showRequestBluetoothPermissionDialog

        public static void showRequestBluetoothPermissionDialog(android.app.Activity activity,
                                        int requestCode)
        Helper method for displaying the built in Android dialog, requesting permission to turn on Bluetooth.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity you want the dialog to appear on.
        requestCode - The request code to identify the permission request.

      • deviceSupportsBluetooth

        public boolean deviceSupportsBluetooth()
        Determines whether the current Android device supports Bluetooth or not.
        Returns:
        True if the device supports Bluetooth, false otherwise.

      • bluetoothIsEnabled

        public boolean bluetoothIsEnabled()
        Determines if Bluetooth is currently enabled on the Android device.
        Returns:
        True if it is enabled, false otherwise.

      • disableBluetooth

        public void disableBluetooth()
        Disables Bluetooth on the Android device by calling BluetoothAdapter.disable()

      • getBluetoothStatus

        public BluetoothAdapterManager.BluetoothStatus getBluetoothStatus()
        Determines what the current BluetoothStatus of the Android device is.
        Returns:
        The current BluetoothAdapterManager.BluetoothStatus

      • startLeScan

        public void startLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback callback,
               android.bluetooth.le.ScanCallback scanCallback,
               java.util.List<android.bluetooth.le.ScanFilter> scanFilters,
               android.bluetooth.le.ScanSettings scanSettings)
        Starts a BLE scan. DO NOT USE!!! See GTConnectionManager.scanAndConnect()
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to use for Pre-Lollipop
        scanCallback - The callback to use for Lollipop +
        scanFilters - The scan filters to use for Lollipop +
        scanSettings - The scan settings to use for Lollipop +

      • stopLeScan

        public void stopLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback callback,
              android.bluetooth.le.ScanCallback scanCallback)
        Stops a BLE scan. DO NOT USE!!!
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback used to start the scan (Pre-Lollipop)
        scanCallback - The callback used to start the scan (Lollipop +)
